title: ISSAQ Student Survey
description: A brief survey that helps you understand your strengths and challenges.

questions.text: In the last 12 months, were you ever hungry but didn’t eat because there wasn’t enough food?
In the last 12 months, have you needed medical care (such as a doctors visit, hospital visit, or medication) but were not able to get it because you couldn’t afford it?
In the last 12 months, have you needed mental health resources but were not able to access them?
Do you have a reliable means of transportation to get to campus?
If they were available to you at no cost, would you be interested in any of the resources below? (Check all that apply)
Do you plan to work (either on-campus or off-campus) during your first year?
Do you have a commute to get to campus?
Do you have a mobile device with WIFI capability?
Do you have a laptop or desktop computer that you can use for classwork?
I know how to identify possible career options based on my strengths, values and interests
I know how to choose between occupations
I know how what kind of classes to take in order to prepare for my career
I know how my classes prepare me for my career
I know how my major and career goals are related
I know how to gain practical experience in my field of study
I know how to gain experience to prepare me for my career
I often worry about things
I panic easily
I get stressed out easily
I sometimes get overwhelmed by anxiety
I get upset easily
I am nervous most of the time
I am always worried about something
I ask a relative or friend for advice
I blame myself for what happened
I talk to someone to find out more about the situation
I get support from others
I come up with a couple of different solutions to the problem
I try to keep my feelings to myself
I wish the situation would go away
I get advice from other people
I try to understand the problem better
People get what they want if they work hard for it
I believe that "practice makes perfect"
Practicing something is just as important as being good at it
You get smarter the harder you work in school
Working hard is more important than being smart
Your intelligence is set at birth and doesn’t change much over your lifetime
Smart people do not need to try hard to do well in school
I take notes in class
I pay attention in class
I always get my homework done
I show up to class on time
I read things that are assigned to me
I get my assignments done on time
I ask questions in class
I participate in class discussions
I worry about being able to pay for college
I worry about not having enough money for the basic necessities of life (for example clothing, food, rent.)
I worry about running out of money
I worry about transportation to get to and from school
Getting a college degree is important to me
The benefits of a college degree outweigh the costs
I’m proud of myself when I do well in school
I can be successful without a college degree
I am determined to get a college degree
My family supports me going to college
Getting a college degree is a major accomplishment
My friends support me going to college
I’ll do whatever it takes to be successful in college
I need a college degree to achieve my goals
My friends and family think a college degree is important
Getting a college degree is one of my top priorities
I feel that asking for help means that I lack ability
I seek out help so I can better understand a problem
When I have a problem, I try to solve it on my own instead of asking for help
When I have trouble solving a problem on my own, I often give up rather than asking for help
I feel like a failure when I need help solving a problem
Getting help would be admitting that I just can’t solve problems on my own
I am embarrassed when I have to ask for help
When you have a problem, seeking out help is a good thing
When I need help, I don’t care that others know
This is one of the best schools in the nation
I feel connected to this school
I see myself as part of this school’s community
I am happy to be at this school
I feel a sense of belonging to this school
I tend to follow a schedule
I use a calendar to keep track of things
I like to do things according to a plan
I set aside specific times to study
I make checklists
I like to make a schedule for big assignments
I have at least one place I like to study
I like a challenge
I finish what I start
I don’t quit a task before it’s finished
I don’t give up easily
I work hard even when challenges get in my way
I don’t let "haters" get in my way
I pay attention to details
I think before I act
I choose my words carefully
The quality of my work is important to me
I work until something is done right
I double check my work
I am not sure where my life is going
I doubt my ability to succeed in college
I tend to see things through
I know how to get things done
I’m not sure if I’ll be able to finish my college degree
I know I can finish my college degree
I know I will do well in college
I feel comfortable with who I am
No one on campus would notice if one day I disappeared
Sometimes I feel as if I was invisible to faculty and staff on campus
I am not someone students would turn to when they need something
There are lots of students at this school like me
Faculty and staff will go out of their way to help me
When I am on campus, no one recognizes me
There are people at this school that take pride in my accomplishments
Faculty and staff remember my name
The faculty and staff here do not care what happens to me
